nodes.text: Leland Chee (born March 1, 1971) is a Lucasfilm official and the person who maintains the Holocron continuity database. He was a frequent presence on the former StarWars.com forums, where he went by the screennames "Tasty Taste" and "Leland Y Chee." He was also the main tester for the Episode I video game, and maintains the Indycron continuity database (the equivalent database for the Indiana Jones universe).

After The Walt Disney Company's acquisition of Lucasfilm, Chee, alongside creative executive Pablo Hidalgo, was assigned a job within the newly formed Lucasfilm Story Group, whose main purpose was to eliminate the Star Wars franchise's canon hierarchy and create one cohesive canon.

As George Lucas is considered the highest level of continuity (G-canon) in Star Wars fandom, any mention by Lucas of a name, character, place, or thing not previously known as canonical seems to eventually gain that status. This is partly due to the item being added to the Holocron database, if it has not been used in literature or other media beforehand.

After Lucas' interview with Jon Stewart at Celebration V, in which Lucas mentioned that Stewjon and Skywalker wine existed, the two were soon after added to the Holocron, as Chee confirmed on his Twitter account.
